clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Cholecalciferol Supplementation on Bone Health and Muscle Strength in Adults During Post-burn Period
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a One Year Cholecalciferol Supplementation on Bone Health and Muscle Strength in Adults During Post-burn Period

brief_summary.textblock: Vitamin D has pleiotropic effects. Burn patients are at risk of hypovitaminosis D and may experience post-injury osteopenia and sarcopenia. Investigators hypothesized that vitamin D supplementation during one year can improve bone and muscle health in post-burn period.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the protocol (after one year)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the protocol (after one year)
secondary_outcome.description: bone formation and resorption markers (blood concentrations) bone mineral density measurement using dual energy X-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the protocol (after one year)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurements of knee muscles strength on an isokinetic dynamometer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- occurrence of injury between 2005 and 2011
- burn surface area (BSA) greater than 10%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy, renal or liver failure, hypo or hyperparathyroidism, prior vitamin D substitution, treatment using systemic corticosteroids or antiepileptic drugs, regular exposure to ultraviolet B radiation (solarium), unstable cardiovascular disease or acute muscle or skeletal injury prohibiting physical exercise
